description: Scientific Latin / translingual Galago (as a genus name), probably from Wolof golo (“monkey”).

entries.meaning: Any of several species of small, nocturnal and arboreal African primates, of the genus Galago, with a catlike head and very large, translucent eyes. [from 19th c.]
examples: From the trees comes the doleful cry of the black-faced dioch, and the weary rustle of galagos creeping back to their nests after a meticulous night's prowl.
